unlekker.mb2.geo
Class UHeading

java.lang.Object
  unlekker.mb2.util.UMB
      unlekker.mb2.geo.UHeading
All Implemented Interfaces:
UConst
public class UHeading
extends UMB

Represents a 3D heading vector, providing methods to apply that heading to vertex data. Typical uses include aligning a vertex list with an arbitrary axis or "sweeping" a 2D profile along a 3D path. Headings are calculated relative to the base vector <0,0,1>. This code uses an extract of the Apache Commons Mathematics Library, specifically the org.apache.commons.math.geometry package and its Rotation class. http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-math/

Author:
marius

sweep

public static java.util.ArrayList<UVertexList> sweep(UVertexList path,
                                                     UVertexList prof)

sweep

public static java.util.ArrayList<UVertexList> sweep(UVertexList path,
                                                     UVertexList prof,
                                                     float headingDamper)
Using path as a motion path and prof as the outline of a sweep geometry, this function calculates the heading transforms for all vertices in path and places correctly aligned copies of prof at each position.

Parameters:
path -
prof - vertex list defining outline shape to be swept along path, assumed to lie in XY plane and facing along positive Z axis.
headingDamper - damping factor applied to heading vectors, a suggested default would be 0.2f;
Returns:

getHeadings

align

public UGeo align(UGeo geo)

align

public static UGeo align(UGeo geo,
                         UVertex v1,
                         UVertex v2)
Aligns and scales a UGeo instance so that the result geometry lies along the vector given by the input vertices. geo is assumed to be facing "forward" along the positive Z axis and will be scaled along that axis to match the length of the input vector, leaving the X and Y dimensions unchanged.

Parameters:
geo -
v1 -
v2 -
Returns:
